summary: Analytical Programmer possesses strong knowledge of PHP and Javascript programming. Specializes in back-end web, database, and API programming. Quickly masters new software packages and hardware technologies.

work_experiences.company_sub: Merged with Heartland Payment Systems, Inc. in April 2016
work_experiences.description: Working remotely to build and maintain several corporate WordPress and Zend Framework 2 sites.
accomplishments: Took ownership of AWS administration.
Assisted marketing campaigns by building landing pages from Adobe Photoshop files into HTML5 sites with jQuery and Bootstrap.
Improved security and performance of sites using code reviews and results of penetration testing.
Improved user experience on forms by building custom WordPress plugins that allowed for AJAX-style submits.
Combated spam on forms by implementing honeypot anti-bot system.
Administrated Salesforce and wrote code to interface with Salesforce API.

work_experiences.description: Building complex field ticketing and reporting systems using ExtJS,CouchDB, and Node.js.
accomplishments: Allowed for printable HTML reports in ExtJS by building custom library.
Improved local development and testing procedures by using Vagrant and Grunt.
Synchronized CouchDB and SQL Server data using LoopBack.
Stepped up to assist clients in saving time and money by applying creative and tested solutions to their problems.

work_experiences.description: Build and maintain Zend Server clusters for PHP applications. Create and document deployment code and processes. Maintain and update legacy systems.
accomplishments: Helped out later engineers with excellent documentation of server environments.
Improved performance and SEO scoring of client sites by setting up SSL and using CloudFlare to improve response times.
Allowed CMS systems such as WordPress or Magento to run on clustering setups using NFS mounting and writing custom deployment code for Zend Server.
Saved on maintenance costs on clients' WordPress sites by migrating them to multi-site install on Zend Server cluster system.

work_experiences.description: Build applications for clients using PHP, JavaScript, ActionScript, MySQL, PostgreSQL and other technologies.
accomplishments: Built system for evaluating nursing students using Zend Framework for back-end code and ActionScript for tablet application. This included AJAX loading effects and JSON webservices in back-end.
Improved custom-built ad-delivery system to allow customers to submit and schedule video and image advertisements to show on screens at various locations.

Built software for custom-built touchscreen headrests for interactive ad system in taxis. This included creating customized Ubuntu setup to run on touchscreen and building systems to transmit advertisements and schedules to headrests and touches and logs from headrests back to servers through cellular networks.
Improved development processes by switching company's primary version control system from Subversion to Mercurial.
Administrating Salesforce and developing projects that interfaced with Salesforce API.

work_experiences.description: Maintain and extend PHP web application that provided accounting, ordering, and invoicing for major construction supply company. Administering PostgreSQL databases and CentOS servers.
accomplishments: Improved code maintenance work by moving codebase into Subversion.
Led group of five developers in design and development of PHP web applications.
Added user authentication and security model by using LDAP to Active Directory.
Improved performance of database queries through analyzing and using indexes and query rewrites.
Improved synchronization performance between PostgreSQL database and accounting system running on IBM AIX system.
Converted project database from PostgreSQL to SQL Server 2005.

work_experiences.description: Administrating a Windows-based network for an office of 50 employees. This included maintaining, upgrading, and building software applications for use by internal users and to facilitate communications with customers and vendors, encouraging and implementing user and internet security, and building queries and reports to provide critical information to the executive and sales staff.
accomplishments: Moved the company’s primary database storage from Access 2000 to SQL Server
Migrated the primary accounting and sales processing software from Great Plains Account (DOS-based) to Great Plains Dynamics 6.0 (Windows-based)
Developed an application that provided a way for internal processors to access faxes from remote sales staff in a paperless format
Implemented and maintained an EDI system
Utilized VMWare server to massively reduce the amount of time and money spent on physical servers for testing and deployment of various systems

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science
accomplishments: Graduated Magna Cum Laude with a 3.85 GPA
Honors Society member
Inline Hockey Club President
Computational Science and Engineering coursework

awards.title: Grand Prize Winning Team
awards.description: The theme of the competition was "Aging in Place", and my team's winning solution was custom built hardware and software that would help elderly people live at home safely through the collection and communication of a person’s medical, social and environmental status. We had beat out 11 other teams (of up to 6 members) in the 28 hour competition to win the $10,000 prize. My main part in the project was to build a custom interfacing system using Arduino and radio receiving hardware and python running on an internet-connected computer to queue and transmit data from remote sensor units to a Joomla-based web application system.
